page.title: 08CHANGES IN LADDINGFORD
page.content: UNTIL A FEW YEARS AGO LADDINGFORD WAS A SMALL VILLAGE SURROUNDED BY ORCHARDS AND HOPFIELDS.MOST OF THE HOUSES IN THE VILLAGE WERE OWNED BY FARMERS AND LIVED IN BY FARM WORKERS AND THEIR FAMILIES WHO WORKED ON THE FARMS. WORK ON THE FARMS HAS NOW CHANGED_ MACHINERY AND MODERN FARMING METHODS MEAN THAT FEWER PEOPLE ARE NEEDED. HOUSES IN THE VILLAGE WERE SOLD OFF AS FARMERS NO LONGER NEEDED THEM.PEOPLE WHO WORKED IN THE TOWN MOVED INTO THE VILLAGE. MOST OF THE FARM BUILDINGS ARE NOW BEING CONVERTED INTO HOMES FOR PEOPLE_THE MOST POPULAR ARE OAST HOUSES AND OLD BARNS. MOST OF THE PEOPLE WORK AWAY FROM THE VILLAGE.
